message_1:
A salesman needs to visit 5 cities in a particular order. The distance between each pair of consecutive cities is given below. Find the shortest possible distance the salesman can travel while visiting all 5 cities exactly once.

City 1 -> City 2: 10 km  
City 1 -> City 3: 15 km  
City 1 -> City 4: 20 km  
City 1 -> City 5: 25 km  
City 2 -> City 3: 35 km  
City 2 -> City 4: 30 km  
City 2 -> City 5: 20 km  
City 3 -> City 4: 22 km  
City 3 -> City 5: 27 km  
City 4 -> City 5: 18 km
message_2:
Since the salesman needs to visit the cities in a particular order, we can assume that the order is City 1 -> City 2 -> City 3 -> City 4 -> City 5. In this case, the shortest possible distance the salesman can travel is simply the sum of the distances between each pair of consecutive cities in this order.

Shortest distance = (City 1 -> City 2) + (City 2 -> City 3) + (City 3 -> City 4) + (City 4 -> City 5)
Shortest distance = 10 km + 35 km + 22 km + 18 km
Shortest distance = 85 km

The shortest possible distance the salesman can travel while visiting all 5 cities exactly once is 85 km.
